com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics.barcode

Interface Code39Util

  • All Superinterfaces:
    BarcodeUtil

    public interface Code39Util
extends BarcodeUtil
    Interface used to configure and draw a Code 39 barcode.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void enableExtendedCharSet(boolean value)
      Enables or disables the extended character set.
      ChecksumMode getChecksumMode()
      Returns the current checksum mode.
      boolean getDisplayChecksum()
      Indicates whether the checksum will be displayed as part of the human-readable message.
      boolean getDisplayStartStopChars()
      Indicates whether the start and stop character will be displayed as part of the human-readable message.
      double getIntercharacterGapWidth()
      Returns the width between encoded characters.
      double getWideFactor()
      Returns the factor by which wide bars are broader than narrow bars.

      Indicates whether the extended character set is enabled.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.zebra.sdk.common.card.graphics.barcode.BarcodeUtil

        doQuietZone, drawBarcode, getBarHeight, getBarWidth, getFont, getHeight, getModuleWidth, getPattern, getQuietZoneWidth, getVerticalQuietZone, hasQuietZone, setBarHeight, setFont, setHeight, setMessagePosition, setModuleWidth, setPattern, setQuietZoneWidth, setVerticalQuietZone

    • Method Detail

      • setChecksumMode

        void setChecksumMode(ChecksumMode mode)
        Sets the checksum mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - The checksum mode.

      • setDisplayChecksum

        void setDisplayChecksum(boolean value)
        Enables or disables the use of the checksum in the human-readable message.
        Parameters:
        value - True to include the checksum in the human-readable message.

      • setDisplayStartStopChars

        void setDisplayStartStopChars(boolean value)
        Enables or disables the use of the start and stop characters in the human-readable message.
        Parameters:
        value - True to enable the leading and trailing "*" to be displayed.

      • enableExtendedCharSet

        void enableExtendedCharSet(boolean value)
        Enables or disables the extended character set.
        • The extended character set enables the whole ASCII 7-bit character set for Code39.
        Parameters:
        value - True to enable the extended character set

      • setIntercharacterGapWidth

        void setIntercharacterGapWidth(double width)
        Sets the width between the characters to encode.
        Parameters:
        width - The inter-character gap width.

      • setWideFactor

        void setWideFactor(double value)
        Sets the factor by which wide bars are broader than narrow bars.
        Parameters:
        value - The wide factor. (should be > 1.0).

      • getChecksumMode

        ChecksumMode getChecksumMode()
        Returns the current checksum mode.
        Returns:
        The checksum mode.

      • getDisplayChecksum

        boolean getDisplayChecksum()
        Indicates whether the checksum will be displayed as part of the human-readable message.
        Returns:
        True if checksum will be included in the human-readable message.

      • getDisplayStartStopChars

        boolean getDisplayStartStopChars()
        Indicates whether the start and stop character will be displayed as part of the human-readable message.
        Returns:
        True if leading and trailing "*" will be displayed.

      • isExtendedCharSetEnabled

        boolean isExtendedCharSetEnabled()
        Indicates whether the extended character set is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if the extended character set is enabled.

      • getIntercharacterGapWidth

        double getIntercharacterGapWidth()
        Returns the width between encoded characters.
        Returns:
        The inter-character gap width.

      • getWideFactor

        double getWideFactor()
        Returns the factor by which wide bars are broader than narrow bars.
        Returns:
        The wide factor.
